description.narrative: Support to Danmission through the Danish Arab Partnership Programme

organisation.narrative: The Middle East and Northern Africa

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: By the end of project period, at least 15 persons from Denmark and MENA have been trained in project management, and at least 15 dialogue initiatives have been funded via the strategic reserve.

target.value: 15 persons trained in project management; 15 dialogue initiatives funded by the strategic reserve.

actual.value: 153 participants have been trained. enabling them to start up efficient local initiatives after end training (such initiatives have been funded by the strategic reserve); 10 projects ere funded by the strategic reserve

title.narrative: During 2016, the capacity among religious leaders and civil society actors is increased, and participants prove their willingness to engage in diminishing religious tensions and sectarian violence in relation to the situation in Syria by reporting their own contributions and initiatives.

target.value: Religious leaders and civil society actors participating in Danmission’s activities.

actual.value: 27 religious leaders and 140 civil society activists have participated in capacity-building activities. Through official statements. workshops. seminars. and local initiatives. they have proved their willingness to engage in dialogue and reconciliation activities and thus diminished religious. tensions and sectarian violence in Syria.

title.narrative:
By the end of project period, at least five new cross-country partnerships will have been established as a result of the initiatives facilitated by Danmission and its partners.
By the end of the project period, at least 85 articles and media clips on dialogue and multi faith initiatives for peace building and reconciliation have been published

target.value: At least 85 articles and media clips published

actual.value: 586 articles and media clips registered overall (135 in 2017) including on the topics dialogue and multi faith initiatives for peace building and reconciliation

title.narrative: By the end of the project period, at least 1120 religious actors, leaders and civil society actors in the MENA region and Denmark have actively engaged in management of religious, political, cultural and ethnic diversity.

target.value: 1120 religious actors. leaders and civil society actors in MENA and Denmark engaged.
1120 religious actors. leaders and civil society actors in MENA and Denmark engaged.
1120 religious actors. leaders and civil society actors in MENA and Denmark engaged.
1120 religious actors. leaders and civil society actors in MENA and Denmark engaged.

actual.value: 979 (79 in 2013. 320 in 2014. 406 in 2015. 174 in 2016) religious actors. leaders and civil society actors in the MENA region and Denmark have actively been engaged in management of religious. political. cultural and ethnic diversity.

title.narrative: By the end of project period, at least 80% of the participants report that they have accessed new knowledge, skills and opportunities through seminars and local activities, and that they have used it for implementing local activities. They express better understanding of “the other”.

target.value: 80% of participants express better understanding of “the other” and gaining new knowledge and skills used implementing local activities.

actual.value: 87.5% (21/24) of the participants (30) in EWCE answering the evaluation form expressed that their understanding of and experience with dialogue had improved during the seminar. Through the years the LIU participants have in general expressed that they have gained knowledge e.g. in 2016. 15 of 21 (71%) express increased understanding of interreligious dialogue. More than 80% of the participants in SYE report that they have changed at least one perception about “the other”. A clear majority (approx. 85%) of the LIU participants have implemented local activities throughout the years. Likewise. the participants of EWCE created an online campaign. with a total outreach of 12500 views/likes/shares. The campaign reached people from MENA region. European countries and the US.

title.narrative: Danmission, CEOSS, Adyan and FDCD conduct cooperation based on theory of change.

target.value: Cooperation based on theory of change.

actual.value: Danmission and partners have developed a theory of change and use it actively.

title.narrative: By the end of project period, Danmission has strengthened the partnership with at least five organizations in the region including non-capitalbased organisations, two-three new partnerships have evolved focusing on interfaith dialogue, and Danmission and its partners have increased their engagement in Arab-European dialogue.

target.value: Five strengthened partnerships. including non-capital based. and two-three new partnerships.

actual.value: Five strengthened partnerships. one of which is non-capital based. and five new partnerships. two of which are non-capital based.

target.value: Five strengthened partnerships. including non-capital based. and two-three new partnerships.

actual.value: Five strengthened partnerships. one of which is non-capital based. and five new partnerships. two of which are non-capital based.

title.narrative: By the end of project period, the Contact Group has established an internet forum, consolidating the partnership between participants of the conferences.

target.value: An internet forum has been established.

actual.value: The Contact Group has established an internet forum with 69 active members. The forum is part of a website where articles by participants are collected and shared.

title.narrative: During 2016, increased awareness and understanding regarding diversity and equal citizenship among a network of community and religious leaders in Syria have prevailed. Moreover, the network working against hate-speech and misuse of the religious platform for instigating hatred instead of peaceful co-existence between religions in Syria.

target.value: A network of community and religious leaders in Syria have increased awareness of equal citizenship and is working against hatespeech and for increasing social cohesion.

actual.value: Two conferences in 2014 and 2016 have brought together a group of Syrian religious leaders that had not been interacting before. This in itself was an accomplishment and a strategic effort in a sensitive Syrian context. The conferences furthermore led to the creation of a network and several local initiatives working against hatespeech and for social cohesion.
